data: For use by the Addiction Medicine Consult Team or in consultation with Addiction Consult Team only
Objective Alcohol Withdrawal Assessment Scoring Criteria
Record q1h until score _____ or below for 3 consecutive measures, then q8h for 24 hour, then if score remains ____ or less, continue once daily for 3 day
Nurse to contact MD if patient still has signs of withdrawal after 96 hours
Nurse to contact MD if Objective Alcohol Withdrawal Assessment score is _____ or greater for 3 consecutive readings or when patient has seizures or hallucinations
Pulse above 120, Systolic BP above 180 mmHg, Diastolic BP above 120 mmHg, or O2 saturation below 90% or hallucinations, unresponsive to Treatment, disoriented
Nurse to contact MD immediately when respiratory rate less than 8/min or SBP below 90 mmHg

For patients at elevated risk for Wernicke's encephalopathy select higher dose of IV thiamine
500 mg, IV, TID, order duration: 2 day, drug form: inj

100 mg, PO, qdaily, order duration: 7 day, drug form: tab
Benzodiazepine orders in effect for 96 hours
If/when RR less than 8/min, slurred speech, ataxia, disoriented, difficult to rouse, altered mental status, then HOLD benzodiazepines and notify treatment provider
Avoid diazepam in patients who are elderly, or have severe liver or respiratory disease
